latestAction.text: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

item.title: SGR Repeal and Medicare Provider Payment Modernization Act of 2014

item.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 228 - 184 (Roll no. 126). (text: CR H2374-2375)
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 228 - 184 (Roll no. 126).(text: CR H2374-2375)
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 227 - 193 (Roll no. 125). (consideration: CR H2383)
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 515.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H2374-2383, H2385)
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 91.

The resolution provides for one hour of debate on H.R. 3189. The rule makes in order as original text for the purpose of amendment an amendment in the nature of a substitute recommended by the Committee on Natural Resources now printed in the bill and provides that it shall be considered as read. The rule provides for a closed rule for H.R. 4015 with one hour of debate on the bill.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 113-379, by Mr. Burgess.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 113-379, by Mr. Burgess.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3189) to prohibit the conditioning of any permit, lease, or other use agreement on the transfer, relinquishment, or other impairment of any water right to the United States by the Secretaries of the Interior and Agriculture; providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 4015) to amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act to repeal the Medicare sustainable growth rate and improve Medicare payments for physicians and other professionals, and for other purposes; and providing for proceedings during the period from March 17, 2014, through March 21, 2014.

bill.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3189) to prohibit the conditioning of any permit, lease, or other use agreement on the transfer, relinquishment, or other impairment of any water right to the United States by the Secretaries of the Interior and Agriculture; providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 4015) to amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act to repeal the Medicare sustainable growth rate and improve Medicare payments for physicians and other professionals, and for other purposes; and providing for proceedings during the period from March 17, 2014, through March 21, 2014.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
